unnormalised: I'm applying for a job and they're asking for various identification numbers. What are they and where do I find them?
normalised: I am applying for a job and they are asking for various identification numbers. What are they and where do I find them?

unnormalised: Many organisations and institutions require specific identification numbers for administrative, verification, and compliance purposes, especially in the context of education and employment in India. Understanding what these identifiers are and where to locate them is crucial. For example, when applying to several companies, I was asked to provide the details of my PAN card (Permanent Account Number), provided by the Income Tax Department. This is a 10-character alphanumeric identifier and is essential for financial transactions and tax-related matters. You can typically find it on your PAN card.
normalised: Many organizations and institutions require specific identification numbers for administrative, verification, and compliance purposes, especially in the context of education and employment in India. Understanding what these identifiers are and where to locate them is crucial. For example, when applying to several companies, I was asked to provide the details of my P-A-N card (Permanent Account Number), provided by the Income Tax Department. This is a ten-character alphanumeric identifier and is essential for financial transactions and tax-related matters. You can typically find it on your P-A-N card.

unnormalised: Also, institutions often ask for your Aadhaar No. This is a 12-digit unique identification number issued to all Indian residents by UIDAI (Unique Identification Authority of India). It serves as a proof of identity and address and is used in various government and private services. Your Aadhaar number is printed on your Aadhaar card. Many companies ask for details of your voter ID card, for example EPIC No. WB1234567.
normalised: Also, institutions often ask for your Aadhaar Number. This is a twelve-digit unique identification number issued to all Indian residents by U-I-D-A-I (Unique Identification Authority of India). It serves as a proof of identity and address and is used in various government and private services. Your Aadhaar number is printed on your Aadhaar card. Many companies ask for details of your voter I-D card, for example E-P-I-C Number W-B one two three four five six seven.

unnormalised: For educational institutions, youâ€™ll likely need your roll number and registration number. These are issued by the specific school or college you attended. The roll number, like 1234/2020, identifies you within a class or batch, and the registration number is a unique identifier assigned by the institution for their records. You can find these on your mark sheets, student ID card, or other official documents issued by your educational institution. For example, one of the forms asked for my CBSE registration number, which I was able to locate on my class 10th certificate.
normalised: For educational institutions, you will likely need your roll number and registration number. These are issued by the specific school or college you attended. The roll number, like one two three four slash two thousand and twenty, identifies you within a class or batch, and the registration number is a unique identifier assigned by the institution for their records. You can find these on your mark sheets, student I-D card, or other official documents issued by your educational institution. For example, one of the forms asked for my C-B-S-E registration number, which I was able to locate on my class tenth certificate.

unnormalised: Finally, the EPF (Employee Provident Fund) number is an important identifier related to employment. It is a unique number assigned to employees who are members of the EPF scheme, managed by the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). It is often mentioned as establishment ID e.g., DL/12345/123 and a member ID. This number is crucial for tracking your contributions and withdrawals from the fund. Your EPF number can be found on your salary slips or through the EPFO portal. Providing these numbers accurately is vital for a smooth application process.
normalised: Finally, the E-P-F (Employee Provident Fund) number is an important identifier related to employment. It is a unique number assigned to employees who are members of the E-P-F scheme, managed by the Employees' Provident Fund Organization (E-P-F-O). It is often mentioned as establishment I-D e.g., D-L slash one two three four five slash one two three and a member I-D. This number is crucial for tracking your contributions and withdrawals from the fund. Your E-P-F number can be found on your salary slips or through the E-P-F-O portal. Providing these numbers accurately is vital for a smooth application process.
